title: The Golden Deer's Plea
opening: Shortly after reclaiming the Kingdom capital, a request for aid arrives from Claude. To save the Alliance from ruin, you head to Derdriu, the Aquatic Capital.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: We have received a request for aid from the Alliance. They are being invaded by the Empire. We have only just taken back Fhirdiad, and yet I am already asking all of you to move out once more. Please accept my apologies for that.

dialogue.speaker: Ingrid
dialogue.line: That's no problem at all. More importantly, how is the Alliance faring?

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: House Riegan has rallied the Alliance Lords. They are facing the enemy with all the strength they can muster. But we do not know how far that will get them. It seems the enemy's relentless attacks have forced them into a tough situation. Their defeat at Gronder severely weakened the Alliance. I imagine the Empire now intends to destroy them before they can recover.

dialogue.speaker: Gilbert
dialogue.line: To think they'd watch us chase their soldiers out of the kingdom capital, then immediately go invade the Alliance... Their general is Lord Volkhard von Arundel. He serves as regent to the Emperor. He has presumably taken command after the Emperor was wounded in Gronder.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: He is known for his shrewdness and excels not only in domestic affairs, but tactics as well. He is not an opponent we should take lightly. Lord Arundel...

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Are you concerned?

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: I always suspected that Lord Arundel was behind the tragedy nine years ago. The timing of his departure from the kingdom, the fact that he abruptly stopped making donations... Too many factors made him suspect. If Lord Arundel conspired with Cornelia... then what Kronya and the others said five years ago...

dialogue.speaker: Gilbert
dialogue.line: Hmm...

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Well, nevermind that for now. The Alliance needs our help. What are your thoughts?

dialogue.speaker: Gilbert
dialogue.line: If we turn our back on the Alliance and then Derdriu falls, it will undoubtedly make our situation difficult further down the road. We would have enemies in two directions... in the Alliance to the northeast and in the Empire to the south.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: That is true. In that scenario, we would not be able to safely march our soldiers to Enbarr.

dialogue.speaker: Flayn
dialogue.line: I'm terribly worried about Lady Rhea... but I believe we must save the Alliance first.

dialogue.speaker: Annette
dialogue.line: Oh! Maybe if we do this, the Alliance will help us out in return! We could ask them to help us attack the Empire. You know, a sneak attack or something!

dialogue.speaker: Mercedes
dialogue.line: Annie! When did you become so devious?

dialogue.speaker: Gilbert
dialogue.line: Heh. What would your mother think.

dialogue.speaker: Annette
dialogue.line: What? It wasn't that devious!

dialogue.speaker: Gilbert
dialogue.line: What do you think, professor?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: Let's march for Derdriu.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: Yes, I agree.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I support whatever Dimitri decides.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: We must go to Derdriu.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: I will admit that there is something to be gained for us as well, for when we eventually march south... But far more importantly... they need us. We cannot turn our backs on them.

dialogue.speaker: Dimitri
dialogue.line: We will arrange to head out at once. Prepare yourselves, everyone.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: it was over 20 years ago... There was an illness raging across Fhirdiad. While people were dying left and right...it was Cornelia who saved the Kingdom from that dreadful illness.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I can't imagine it...

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: Neither can I. By the time I was old enough to understand, that time had already passed.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Cornelia was a doctor?

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: No, I her she was originally an Imperial scholar. She was in the Kingdom by my father's invitation.

conversation.speaker: Dimitri
conversation.line: People praised Cornelia as a saint for ending the epidemic. But there came a day when she completely changed. Her behavior, mannerisms, likes, dislikes...everything. Despite all that, Father still appointed her to a high post. After all, she had saved the Kingdom from ruin by that disease... But above all, my stepmother trusted her. That's why what that woman said is... Never mind.

conversation.speaker: Dedue
conversation.line: Lord Rodrigue Fraldarius has passed on. Margrave Gautier has assumed his position, and is now gathering the lords of the eastern territories. House Gautier is equal in prestige to House Fraldarius. Sylvain is a Gautier. These lords are reorganizing the Faerghus army, and eradicating any remaining factions that claim allegiance to the Empire. Of course, His Highness is being kept appraised with regular reports. But it falls to me to monitor him, and ensure he does not try to take on too much. I would ask you to do the same. If you take your eyes off that man, even for a moment, he is liable to do something rash.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: The very same night we liberated the capital, a messenger arrived from Derdriu. Claude must have predicted that we'd retake it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Definitely.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Could have been a coincidence.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: No, I don't think so. It takes too long to travel to Fhirdiad from Derdriu for it to be chance.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: Claude's a hard person to read. It's obvious not much escapes his eye though. Kind of unsettling, honestly.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Derdriu, the Aquatic Capital... I've heard it's a magnificent city, you know. If we're going, I wish it wasn't to wage war. It'd be more fun to visit with a cute girl on my arm.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Maybe once the war is over...

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: You're right. That's something to look forward to.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Yeah? Maybe you and me? That'd be a good reason to survive the war. Heh heh...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Forget it.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Aw, come on. let a guy dream.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: I went to visit my adoptive father at his home in the capital. He used to grovel at Cornelia's feet when the city was under her control. But after it was liberated, he started courting the Kingdom instead.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Whatever it takes to get ahead.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: I suppose he was just doing what he needed to survive...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's despicable.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Absolutely. He's hopeless. I suppose when you're a merchant, that's all you know.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: No matter what becomes of the world, it'll always be plagued by people like him.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Derdriu, huh? I've always wanted to go there. In Faerghus, most of the towns are pretty much glorified fortresses. So to hear about a place called the Aquatic capital... it just sounds so elegant! When the war's over, I hope I can visit with everyone there!

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: So, House Riegan has regained its influence in the Alliance and is gathering forces. Claude always was somewhat inscrutable. It's strange somehow to hear talk of his brilliance as the leader of the Alliance.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: I have been wondering something... If I had not been your student, where would I be right now? Who would I be? Do you ever think about that sort of thing, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Like what if I had led a different class?

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Ah, so you do think about such questions. You can never find answers though, right? We cannot turn back time, so there is no way to back and try a different path.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Like what if I had allied with the Empire?

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Ah, so you do think about such questions. You can never find answers though, right? We cannot turn back time, so there is no way to back and try a different path.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: No, I don't.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: I see... You are so focused and coolheaded. I wish I could be more like you.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: Traveling to the Empire, to the Kingdom, and then off to Alliance territory... Everyone certainly is busy. Perhaps it's not a bad thing now that I think about it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It's all in the pursuit of peace.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: Peace will be lovely. Peace will, one assumes, be considerably less perilous.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Yes, very busy.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: If only we were only busy, then I think I would be fine. I'd be able to take a nap for one. But If I napped now, I suspect that I soon enough I'd find myself busy dying...

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Didn't they used to call Claude the Master Tactician? I want a nickname too! Maybe I'll get one if I can rescue him at Derdriu... I'll come up with a plan that's even better than his and earn a nickname for sure!

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Claude... Claude... Which one was he again? Oh! Right. Yeah, of course I remember him. It's just... I can't picture his face. Don't remember what he looks like. I'm not sure if I ever knew.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Dimitri is going to Claude's aid. How great is that? It's like we've gone back to how things were five years ago. It's so nice. Just imagine if Edie was there too? I suppose you can't ever really go back to the way things were in the past...

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: I am being told you can see the sea from Derdriu. Not just see...that it is right there in front of you. In Brigid, the sea has great closeness. I would be looking at it every day. But in Garreg Mach, we cannot look at the sea. So I am feeling...drawn to Derdriu.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The ocean is frightening.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: That is true. The ghosts of the sea have vengeance in their hearts. If they are wanting to take you, you cannot be saved.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: The sea is beautiful.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Yes, I think the sea has much beauty. But can also be frightening.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: It seems Dimitri has become downright charitable. But I believe he is operating under a serious misapprehension. It may appear as if Claude is appealing to Dimitri for aid, but that is not what is happening here.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Another one of Claude's tricks?

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: That's not it either. I see it got by you as well.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Did he not actually ask for help?

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: That's not it either. I see it got by you as well.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Is there another interpretation?

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: Yes. A fine example of how snap decisions based on mere appearances can lead to gross misunderstandings.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: Claude has asked for reinforcements from here because he knows I am here. Simply put, he is not throwing himself on Dimitri's mercy. He is throwing himself on mine. I suppose there is nothing else for it, is there? We cannot turn our backs on those in need. Let us grant him the aid he requires.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: We're going to go help Claude? I haven't seen him in forever. Wonder how he's been... I chose this side because I believe in you, Professor. But it's not like I got anything against Claude.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: What was he like?

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Hmm... Well, he loved parties, and he was full of some pretty good jokes!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Were you close?

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Of course! Claude was the kinda person who would be instantly friends with anyone.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: I got no clue what'll happen to the Alliance, but I sure hope Claude doesn't die...

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: So, war finally comes to the Alliance territories. I don't mean that there's never been fighting on Alliance soil, of course. There have been countless skirmishes between neighboring lords, as well as conflicts with Almyra. But this is an invasion by an army of the Empire. It's a whole different animal. I don't want to see my family get dragged into this... I hope we can drive back the Empire.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: The pro-Imperialist lords who've let the Empire in have their hands tied. Houses Ordelia and Gloucester are exposed and likely caught off guard. That must mean that Claude's allies are...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Duke Goneril.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Geographically, it would be hard for him to commit his forces, and logically, it wouldn't make sense for him to offer support.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Margrave Edmund.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Margrave Edmund does not commit troops as easily as he commits funds, so that's doubtful.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Count Daphnel.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Without a doubt she is providing reinforcements. She has always supported Claude.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Whatever the situation, Claude's military strength is lacking, and what's more, they suffered casualties at Gronder Field. I don't know how long the Alliance forces will be able to hold out against the Empire. We've got to move quickly or we may be too late.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: I'm glad Dimitri and Claude don't have to fight one another... I am the daughter of an Alliance lord though, so I suppose that goes without saying. Having to fight with your former classmates is just so terribly sad...

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: We took Fhirdiad back, but I never found the time to go shopping there! When the war's over and the city is revitalized, I'd like to visit again. Will you come with me, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: All right.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Really? Oh, I'm so glad! Although I suppose we have bigger things on our plate, like...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Shouldn't we be more worried about...

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Claude! He's in big trouble. I bet my family is too. We have to help them, Professor! I know we can't lose with you on our side!

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Guess this doesn't end with liberating the Kingdom capital. Derdriu is next. That prince really works his people hard, doesn't he? Or should I be calling him a king now? Whatever the title is, he'll always be Dimitri to me.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: I thought there was a chance that Cornelia had captured Lady Rhea, but it seems that is not the case. Our next foe, Lord Arundel, was once a pious adherent to the Seiros creed. His contributions to the church stopped quite abruptly some time ago. I think it is likely the man knows something.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: You plan to aid Claude, do you not? I think that is absolutely marvelous. Being opposing forces at the battle of Gronder was ill fated. It hurts to side against him. I am happy that things have taken a brighter turn now.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Cornelia Arnim... That's a familiar name, yes. She once studied in the Empire. My understanding is, shortly after I left the Empire, she did as well. Unlike myself, Cornelia traveled to the Kingdom. Apparently she halted a plague, and was rewarded with a quite powerful appointment. That such a an outstanding researcher should fall to such depravity... Sickening, Professor. And quite sad.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: Remember the Death Knight who stabbed me five years ago? Of course you do. How could you forget? Well, it turns out he's a general in the Imperial army, claiming victory on dozens of battlefields. But it looks like he's not at Derdriu. Like every man in my life, he's run away from me... And he better run! One day, I'm gonna find that guy and pay him back for what he did to me!

conversation.speaker: Gilbert
conversation.line: With the capital recaptured. I desire to call him Your Majesty rather than Your Highness. He would refuse my desire, rightfully pointing out that he has not, as yet, been crowned. However, the day this war has ended, and the church has placed the crown upon his head... Then, he will truly be our king, and I will call him Your Majesty at last. I must go hear the reports from our spies. There is something worrying me and—No. I can wait. I shall tell you more when our information is more concrete.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: I was getting excited for our big Empire showdown! I spent so much time mentally preparing. Then we shifted focus to Derdriu. I hadn't been expecting that. But, as a knight who's sworn to serve the goddess, I cannot turn a blind ear to those who seek my aid.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: We're still searching for Lady Rhea. No news on that, I'm afraid. Lord Arundel, the emperor's uncle, is the regent of the Empire. If we crush them at Derdriu, maybe we'll capture him and wring some clues out of him.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: Claude, eh? He always was sharp among his peers. Never let himself get caught up in conventions. He wasn't typical in Fódlan. I'd like to save him if we can.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We'll make it in time.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: I know. And I'm sure he's already calculated exactly when that will be.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: He's too determined to die.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: Heh. You may be right.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: Ugh, even if we do enter Alliance territory, we're not gonna find Lady Rhea there. I wish we could leave Claude be and go attack the Empire. I suppose if we can't beat the Empire forces here, then we can't get into the Empire lands, can we? I guess that means it's just hard work time, huh, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! Derdriu is known as the Aquatic capital... It's a beautiful town with streets that seem to float on the water and an impressive harbor. In times of peace, it would be a wonderful place for a holiday... Anyway! Best of luck in the next battle!

intro.speaker: Alliance Soldier 1
intro.line: The citizens of Derdriu have all been evacuated and are now at sea! Are you sure about this? If Derdriu were to fall, those ships don't have enough resources for --

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Derdriu won't fall. Have some faith in me, will you?

intro.speaker: Alliance Soldier 1
intro.line: Oh! Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Alliance Soldier 2
intro.line: Our line of defense has been broken! The Imperial army will be here any moment!

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Understood. You two join up with the troops in the city.

intro.speaker: Alliance Soldier 2
intro.line: Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Judith, are you ready?

intro.speaker: Judith
intro.line: As ready as I'll ever be. It's been years since I last battled in the city streets.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: Don't go messing up because your vision has weakened with age. Take the defensive for now.

intro.speaker: Judith
intro.line: Yeah, yeah, I get it. You hang in there, too, boy. Your wounds from Gronder Field haven't fully healed yet, have they?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: No, but it's not like I can sit this one out. I have to make my daring escape, after all. And for the last time, stop calling me boy! That's an official order from the leader of the Alliance.

intro.speaker: Judith
intro.line: Understood, Leader Man. I wonder if our little ray of hope will show up... We fought on opposite sides at Gronder, didn't we?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: They'll come. You can count on it. If anyone can bring him back, it's Teach. Teach will talk, and he'll listen. But more than anything, I've their skill and abilities... I believe in them.

intro.speaker: Alliance Soldier 3
intro.line: Claude! Reinforcements are coming from the west! Their banner is that of the Kingdom...

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: What did I tell you? They're here. And just in time.

intro.speaker: Gilbert
intro.line: It appears the Imperial army has already marched into Derdriu and engaged the Alliance. It seems the Imperial advance has been stalled by guerrilla skirmishes. The Alliance forces are holding out, but they won't last much longer...

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: That must be Judith of House Daphnel who joined up with Claude's troops. To think Judith, a true hero, would find herself backed into a corner like this...

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: It is not so. The Alliance has only drawn the enemy so deeply into the city to allow us to attack them from behind. Brilliant.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: They're planning a pincer attack?

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: I believe so. He put his soldiers into position purely on the belief that we'd come... I can't believe Claude would risk everything on that behalf. He has placed all of his hopes on us. Let's make sure we live up to his expectations, Professor.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Here we go. Let's move!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: My plan failed... Teach. Dimitri. That's enough. Time to retreat. I've crossed one too many bridges... It's a shame, but... It's over now...

battle-talk.speaker: Dimitri
battle-talk.line: You're OK... Can you still fight, Claude?

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: You barely snatch me from the jaws of death, and now you're recruiting me! You sure know how to inspire loyalty, Your Majesty. Sadly, I'm not free to move here, for many reasons. You'll have to repel the Empire without me...

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: Professor, if you had chosen me instead of Dimitri... No. I shouldn't dwell on it. I'm grateful you came. I'm glad to have your strength, if only for today.

boss.speaker: Lord Arundel
boss.line: Clever. I can't believe they pushed through to here. Nothing is more foolish than dying in vain. Let's get to the harbor and finish off the leader of the Alliance!

boss.speaker: Lord Arundel
boss.line: Nothing bites so hard as a cornered rat, eh?

boss.speaker: Lord Arundel
boss.line: You would raise a weapon against your uncle? You've grown into a savage of a man, just like your father.

boss.speaker: Dimitri
boss.line: You are rather calm for one in your position. Or did you forget that this is a battlefield? Perhaps this is no time for words, Uncle. There will be time for that after we have settled things here.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Uncle, I need to know. The incident nine years ago ... You were involved, weren't you? You know something. What did Cornelia... No. What did my stepmother do?!

end.speaker: Lord Arundel
end.line: You are not qualified to look into the darkness... You and Edelgard... Do your best to kill each other... You are family, after all. There it is... the light...

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: He's dead. There goes our chance to gain more information. Then again, even if we had managed to capture him alive, judging by the way he was acting...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: For now, let's rejoice in our victory.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: We can think about that later.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Teach is absolutely right. We should take this rare opportunity to let off some tension.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: It's been a long time, Claude. I am glad to see that you're safe.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Same. I haven't seen you since the nightmare that was Gronder. You really did come to help us... You must be a bunch of soft-hearted suckers, eh?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: If you really felt that way, you would not have set up a defensive battle in the hopes that we would come. It worked out, only because we made it in time... Were you really so confident that we would answer the call?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Of course. I knew you wouldn't hesitate to put yourself second and come running to our aid.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: You know him well.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: How insightful.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: You and I are cut from different cloth. I wouldn't make a move unless I could gain something from it. You've always been just the opposite. And of course, I've always been fond of taking dangerous risks. After all, I sent that express messenger before you had even recaptured the kingdom capital. If all went to plan, I knew you'd recapture it soon, and then respond to our request for aid. It was riskier than usual, I'll give you that. But it was the only card I had to play, so I took the gamble.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: You cross too many dangerous bridges for my liking.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: I know, I know. But... that ends today.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: What do you mean?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Here, take this. Use it however you see fit.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: The legendary bow, Failnaught... Isn't this the hero's relic of house Riegan? Hold, Claude. This must be one of your jokes. You cannot truly intend to part with this...

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: It's not a joke. As of today, the Leicester alliance is no more.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Just what are you planning, Claude?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: If you're going to lead Fódlan, then the alliance Lords will follow you. Back in the day, the Alliance split off from the kingdom. I'm just putting us back together again. Oh, and I've already gained the support of the other Lords at the roundtable conference, so you can stop looking at me like I'm crazy. All that's left for me is to officially step down as the leader of the Alliance.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: What will you do now?

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Will you join our army?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Hold your horses there, Teach.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: I'm leaving Fódlan. There are things I have to do. Dreams I need to see to fruition. That's why I became the Alliance leader to begin with, actually. But it left me no time for what I was really after. You'd better not take on too many responsibilities yourselves, or else you'll end up in the same boat. And remember... both the living and the dead cling to us without any regard for our own lives. It's up to us to break free of that weight and follow the path that we believe in.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Claude...

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Oops! I almost forgot the most important thing. If you're looking for Rhea, apparently she's being held captive in the imperial capital. It doesn't sound like they intend to kill her, but there's no telling what they're planning.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: You have my gratitude, Claude.

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Gratitude? Thanks but no thanks. As far as I'm concerned, we're even now. I don't know how many years will pass until then, but let's promise to meet again. And when we do... don't be too hard on me, your Kingliness.

end.speaker: Felix
end.line: Well, Dimitri? Are you finally going to tell us the damned truth?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: What are you talking about?

end.speaker: Ashe
end.line: Didn't Lord Arundel say something about you and Edelgard being family?

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: To claim that the king and the emperor are related... Could it be?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Ah, I suppose I never told you, though I do recall mentioning it briefly to the professor... Lord Arundel spoke the truth. My stepmother was Edelgard's birth mother. Political turmoil drove my stepmother out of the Empire. Father fell in love with her at first sight and they married. I lost my birth mother before I was old enough to remember her. My stepmother filled that role for me. But she lost her life in Duscur nine years ago, along with Father.

end.speaker: Felix
end.line: Hang on, I didn't even know she was your stepmother. Did my father know about this?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Yes. All those who were close to my father knew, including Rodrigue. But to speak openly about it would have caused a scandal, and so she was our secret. No one in the general public knew about her. Naturally, the fact that Edelgard and I are stepsiblings was kept a secret as well.

end.speaker: Mercedes
end.line: I'm finally beginning to understand what you went through five years ago. I mean, Edelgard is the only family you have left, isn't she? To find out someone so precious to you is actually your most hated enemy... How heartbreaking.

end.speaker: Annette
end.line: But wait! You two were born and raised in two different territories, right? So you probably never met until you were both at the academy. I mean, don't get me wrong, I think the idea of fighting family is just about the worst thing ever. But hopefully the fact that she's a stepsister you never really knew helps with the pain... I don't know, it was just a thought.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: I am afraid that's not the case. Though it was only for a short time, Edelgard once called Fhirdiad home. It was a long time ago, but she was a cherished friend of mine.

end.speaker: Sylvain
end.line: Wait! I remember now! She was that girl, wasn't she? The one you gave a dagger to! Heh, so your little girlfriend was Edelgard.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Sylvain. If you have any more foolish things to say, please hold them for later.

end.speaker: Sylvain
end.line: I do have a few more up my sleeve, but they can wait. Go on, Your Highness. This is important for us to hear.

end.speaker: Felix
end.line: She may be a hated enemy now, but the emperor is your old friend and stepsister. Can you bring yourself to kill her?

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: I will kill her... if I must. But if there is any chance that the world she seeks to create could be a just one... Then I... I would love to see a future in which I may reach out my hand for her and have her reach back. That said, I have no intention of letting my personal feelings cloud my judgment. Too much is at stake.

end.speaker: Ashe
end.line: Your Highness... I think you should meet with the emperor and at least try to talk to her. If there's any hope of ending this war without more bloodshed, we have to try. Besides, killing your own family... I'm sorry, but it's not right.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: I...I think so too. And you are right that we should at least try.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: I see. So my uncle's defeat is beyond doubt?

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: Yes, Your Majesty. I have confirmed it via countless channels. I advise that we accept this as a drop of joy amid a pool of sorrow.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Pretty words, but I'm afraid we can't rest until the joy outweighs the sorrow. And for that to happen, it now seems we must confront them all at once. Dimitri, who took back Fhirdiad... Claude, who managed to protect the Alliance...And that professor, who is successfully mobilizing the Knights of Seiros...

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: What will you do, Your Majesty?

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Pull back our forces. In the west, to Arianrhod. In the east, to—

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: Fort Merceus, I presume? There is no better place for such a confrontation after all.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Indeed. And dispatch the Death Knight to guard it. He can buy us some time. In the meantime, I will—

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: Forgive me, but I must speak bluntly. I do not agree with what you intend to do. Though slight, there is a chance that once done, it cannot be undone.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Even I cannot choose the direction my path leads me. There is no other way. And so, I must walk on.
